book.title: The Story of a Dog and a Cat
book.author: Melton Mowbray

book.title: Animals With Fewer Than Five Feet, Such as Cats
book.author: Dr Eisenhower

book.title: Angelic Intervention For Those Who Train Cats
book.author: John Dee

book.title: Software For Fun and Profit
book.author: William Gates, Jr.
book.para: Sometimes usability is the most important thing. Sometimes usability is the only thing. Sometimes usability is nothing.

book.title: Software For Fun and Profit, 2nd edition
book.author: William Gates, Jr.
book.para: Usability is highly overrated. My advice is similar to that Heinlein gave prospective authors: you must write, you must finish what you write, you must publish what you write. Ship software, pay the bills.

book.title: The Blues
book.author: B.B. King
book.para: The secret of the blues is, you gotta sing the first line twice. Yes, the secret of the blues is, you gotta sing that first line twice. After that, it all comes out just nice.

book.title: No Bad Software
book.author: The Code Whisperer
book.para: The key is to let the software know who is the alpha leader. Do not be fooled into letting the code run the household.

book.title: Ninja Coder
book.author: I.M. Hacker
book.para: Amazingly enough, many people believe that nunchuks are not useful to software development! They prefer usability studies to the swift application of physical means of persuasion. Hah! The ninja coder knows otherwise.
